title: Kim Kardashian wants to monitor her kids on social media
text:
Kim Kardashian will monitor her kids on social media (Picture: Instagram)

Kim Kardashian has revealed she wants to monitor her kids when it comes to their social media accounts.

Kim, who has become known for her online presence and boasts a whopping 148millions, knows all too well the highs and lows that come with the likes of Twitter and Instagram.

Trolling can be a real issue and while she’s learnt how to deal with the negativity that sadly comes with being online, she wants to make sure social media is a safe place for her brood.

Kim, who shares four children with husband Kanye West – North, six, Saint, three, Chicago, one and Pslam, four months, said she’ll definitely be monitoring their online accounts when they get them.

In a new interview with Reuters, Kim explained: ‘I would definitely be that mum monitoring my kids on social media as they grow up.

‘I don’t know what it would be like to grow up with social media, I grew up before cell phones, so I don’t know what that would be like… there’s a lot of downfalls with social media such as having to deal with negativity on it.’

Kim boasts a huge 148million followers herself on Instagram (Picture: Kim Kardashian/Instagram)

‘The aspect of how many followers you have can maybe affect the younger users,’ Kim said.

Although, Insta Queen Kim, who is currently visiting Armenia with sister Kourtney, did admit that social media also brings with it ‘amazing benefits’ too.

She was also asked if she wants any more children in the future, but insisted four is her limit.

‘To raise responsible, kind, human beings takes time and dedication, I don’t want to be that parent who doesn’t spend time with each of my children,’ Kim responded. ‘Four is my limit!’
